title: Grenfell: 'My boy would be alive if I'd not listened to firefighters'
text:
The father of a five year-old boy who died in the Grenfell disaster has called for the London Fire Brigade chief to step down immediately or be held “to account” for its failures.

Paulos Tekle - whose son Isaac Paulos perished after a fire fighter lost him in the smoke-filled stairwell - said that he feels “betrayed” that Dany Cotton has not faced any consequences for the LFB’s handling of the blaze.

The official report on the disaster, to be published this morning, has accused the LFB of “serious shortcomings” and “systemic failures” in its response.
